== Possible presidential candidacy ==
== Possible presidential candidacy ==

{{Main|Egyptian presidential election, 2011}}

{{Main|Egyptian presidential election, 2011|Mohamed ElBaradei presidential campaign, 2011}}
ElBaradei's name has been circulated by opposition groups as a possible candidate to succeed President [[Hosny Mubarak]] to Egypt's highest executive position.
ElBaradei's name has been circulated by opposition groups as a possible candidate to succeed President [[Hosny Mubarak]] to Egypt's highest executive position.
<ref>http://www.tehrantimes.com/index_View.asp?code=204908</ref><ref>http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C10%5C07%5Cstory_7-10-2009_pg4_7</ref><ref>http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/291035,arab-league-chief-refuses-to-rule-out-egypt-presidential-bid.html</ref> ElBaradei did not make any clear statements regarding his intentions to run for the office, however he has demanded that certain conditions have to be met to ensure fair elections accompanied by changes to the constitution that will allow more freedom for independent candidates before he would actually consider running for presidency. Several opposition groups and parties have endorsed him, considering him a neutral figure who could transition the country to greater democracy.
<ref>http://www.tehrantimes.com/index_View.asp?code=204908</ref><ref>http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C10%5C07%5Cstory_7-10-2009_pg4_7</ref><ref>http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/291035,arab-league-chief-refuses-to-rule-out-egypt-presidential-bid.html</ref> ElBaradei did not make any clear statements regarding his intentions to run for the office, however he has demanded that certain conditions have to be met to ensure fair elections accompanied by changes to the constitution that will allow more freedom for independent candidates before he would actually consider running for presidency. Several opposition groups and parties have endorsed him, considering him a neutral figure who could transition the country to greater democracy.
